content.question: Which of the following best explains how most candidates are recruited to run for office?

choices.label: Candidates for office usually first work as lawyers for political parties before running for office.
Most candidates who run for office are recruited by political leaders to do so because they are famous.
Political parties usually recruit and train people at the local level they believe are most fit to run for office.
Most candidates running for office are selected after earning merit working for the government.

content.answer: Political parties usually recruit and train people at the local level they believe are most fit to run for office.
